metadata.title: CVE-2021-33909 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
fs/seq_file.c in the Linux kernel 3.16 through 5.13.x before 5.13.4 doesnot properly restrict seq buffer allocations, leading to an integeroverflow, an Out-of-bounds Write, and escalation to root by an unprivilegeduser, aka CID-8cae8cd89f05.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.3.0-76-generic - 5.3.0-76.72
linux-image-5.3.0-76-lowlatency - 5.3.0-76.72
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-76-generic - 5.3.0-76.72
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-76-lowlatency - 5.3.0-76.72
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1027-dell300x - 4.15.0-1027.32
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-1045-gke - 5.3.0-1045.48
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1049-gke - 5.4.0-1049.52~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1021-gkeop - 5.4.0-1021.22~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1092-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1092.98
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-1042-raspi2 - 5.3.0-1042.44
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1109-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1109.118
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-151.157').

linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1').
